content.description: Start matched on the obvious diagonal rail. Make a balancy reach left towards the arete (crux) and then working hands back right to mantle directly up (like a Z).
content.location: On the second boulder you reach from the approach trail. This starts on an obvious large diagonal rail facing the creek.

content.description: Stand start low on good crimps. Work your way up interesting crimps and sidepulls into a shallow dihedral. Make one committing foot smearing move to get above the dihedral (crux) and reach for a good hold then the top.
content.protection: Pad if you can figure out how to squeeze it in.
content.location: In the tight corridor between the two biggest boulders in this area, just right of the v0/vB ledgey problem listed here as "Hollow Heart".

content.description:
Good holds, great movement, good top out.

For v3 sit start with two hands on the obvious chalked sloping rail. Find feet, make a surprisingly difficult hand move right, then up to the better holds of the stand start variation.

For v1 Stand start on a good rail and a great sloper out right. Climb straight up.
content.location: In the Hollow (first Upstream area), this is the most down stream boulder, route starts to the left of the tree.

content.description:
Squat start on the left arete of the boulder, make big moves between good holds up and right under the roof, following the crack under to top out right of the roof.

Variation v3: go directly up from the start reaching out to the top of the roof, cut feet and then mantle at the apex of the roof (crux)
content.location: As you reach the first boulders on the approach, this is the sole problem on the obvious roof capped boulder on the left side across the creek.

content.description:
For v3+: Squat start on two bad crimps, smear the feet and bump to a better hold. Keep the core tight and work up and left on good holds to the top.

For v2-: Start matched on a decent square hold (2nd hold of sit start), finish the problem
content.location: On the right side of the second boulder you get to on the approach trail. To the right of the obvious face with diagonal rail. This problem is in the corner where it meets another little boulder behind you.

content.description:
Start low on the arete on an obvious jug, make a big move up and right to a great pinch-type hold. Work up right along the arete to rock over at the apex of the boulder.

Variation: v0-, start on the same jug, climb directly up the slab to the top.
content.location: On the righthand boulder across the creek from the approach trail. Just to the right of an obvious roof capped boulder. This problem starts on an obvious jug on the right side of the face towards the creek and goes diagonally up the arete.

content.description: Traverse on good jugs and simple topout.
content.location: In the "alley" between boulders looking towards the creek, the route is on the boulder on the left. Start on the creek facing side, and climb left and up on good holds.

content.description: Start with your right hand on the side of a big corner, left hand on a decent crimp. Bring the feet up, make some interesting reaches between positive holds, consider utilizing heel/toe hooks. Great movement
content.location: On the right side of the right hand boulder across the creek from the approach trail. This problem faces downstream

content.description: Located on Second Boulder. Sit start w/ right hand on large Rail, left low on undercling. Match rail, get a left heel hook, traverse up and right into Â V2.

Lowest start on "Slaping for gold". Sit start w/ right hand on low side pull and left hand on sloppy side pull. Bust left hand to slopping rail and make big move right up to decent hold and finish on stand start of " Slapping for Gold"
